protocol.name: LSD Microdosing Protocol for Mood, Creativity, and Cognitive Enhancement
protocol.condition_treated: Subclinical Depression, Anxiety, Low Creativity, Cognitive Performance Enhancement
protocol.overview: Evidence-informed LSD microdosing protocol for mood enhancement, creativity, focus, and general well-being. Uses sub-perceptual doses (typically 5-20 micrograms) on an intermittent schedule. Based on emerging research, anecdotal reports, and harm reduction principles. Note: LSD is Schedule I in most countries; this protocol is for informational/research purposes.
evidence_sources: Fadiman J, Korb S. J Psychoactive Drugs. 2019;51(2):113-122 (PMID: 30925849)
Polito V, Stevenson RJ. PLoS One. 2019;14(2):e0211023 (PMID: 30726251)
Hutten NRPW, et al. J Psychopharmacol. 2019;33(9):1039-1051 (PMID: 31328653)
Family N, et al. Sci Rep. 2020;10:4714 (PMID: 32170127)
Rootman JM, et al. Sci Rep. 2021;11:14920 (PMID: 34290276)

steps.title: Initial Assessment & Goal Setting
steps.description: Comprehensive baseline assessment to establish goals for microdosing, screen for contraindications, assess mental health status, and set realistic expectations.

mental_health_screening: History of depression or anxiety disorders
Personal or family history of psychosis or bipolar disorder
goals_and_intentions: What do you hope to gain from microdosing?
Specific areas of improvement (mood, creativity, focus, relationships, etc.)
prior_psychedelic_experience: Any prior LSD or psychedelic use?
Set and setting quality in past

education_topics: Expected effects (subtle mood lift, enhanced focus, increased openness)
Not expected effects (no hallucinations, no radical personality change)
Dosing schedules (Fadiman protocol, Stamets stack, daily, etc.)
Importance of quality, accurate dosing (volumetric dosing)
Timeline for noticing effects (days to weeks)
Placebo effect considerations (may account for significant portion of effects)

steps.title: Medical & Psychological Contraindication Screening
steps.description: Evaluate medical and psychiatric contraindications to ensure patient safety. LSD microdosing, while lower risk than full doses, still requires careful screening.

cardiovascular: History of heart disease (LSD can cause vasoconstriction, mild BP/HR elevation)
Valvular heart disease (concern for cardiac fibrosis with chronic serotonergic drugs)

absolute_contraindications: Personal history of schizophrenia or psychotic disorder
First-degree relative with schizophrenia (high genetic risk)
Bipolar I disorder with manic episodes
Severe personality disorder with poor reality testing
relative_contraindications: Bipolar II disorder (proceed with extreme caution, monitor for hypomania)
Severe anxiety or panic disorder (may worsen)
Obsessive-compulsive disorder (can worsen obsessions in some)
Current severe depression with suicidal ideation (needs more intensive treatment)
medication_interactions: SSRIs/SNRIs: Common combo, but may reduce LSD effects; no serotonin syndrome risk
MAOIs: Potentially dangerous interaction, absolute contraindication
Lithium: Potentially increases seizure risk, contraindicated
Antipsychotics: Block LSD effects, may be taking for reason that contraindicates LSD
Tramadol: Potential serotonin syndrome risk, avoid
St. John's Wort: Serotonergic, use caution

steps.title: Eligibility & Protocol Selection
steps.description: Determine patient eligibility based on screening and select optimal microdosing protocol (dosing schedule, dose, duration) based on individual factors and goals.

eligibility_assessment.proceed: No absolute contraindications, realistic expectations, willingness to track metrics
eligibility_assessment.defer: Relative contraindication that needs optimization (e.g., unstable mood), medication adjustment needed
eligibility_assessment.exclude: Absolute contraindication present (psychosis history, family schizophrenia, lithium use, MAOI use, pregnancy)

dosing_schedules.name: Fadiman Protocol (Classic)
dosing_schedules.schedule: Day 1: Dose, Day 2: Transition (no dose), Day 3: Normal (no dose), Day 4: Dose again
dosing_schedules.pattern: Every 3 days (1 day on, 2 days off)
dosing_schedules.rationale: Allows observation of effects, transition day, and return to baseline; prevents tolerance
dosing_schedules.best_for: Beginners, those wanting clear on/off comparison, researchers tracking effects

dosing_schedules.name: Stamets Stack (Enhanced)
dosing_schedules.additional_components: LSD + psilocybin mushroom microdose + niacin + lion's mane mushroom
dosing_schedules.rationale: Paul Stamets protocol for neurogenesis and cognitive enhancement; niacin for peripheral vasodilation, lion's mane for nerve growth factor
dosing_schedules.note: This protocol combines LSD or psilocybin with other supplements

dosing_schedules.name: Every Other Day
dosing_schedules.rationale: More frequent dosing without daily tolerance build-up
dosing_schedules.best_for: Those who benefit from more frequent dosing, depression/anxiety management

dosing_schedules.name: Intuitive/As-Needed
dosing_schedules.schedule: Dose when you feel you need it (1-3 times per week)
dosing_schedules.rationale: Flexible approach based on individual response and needs
dosing_schedules.best_for: Experienced microdosers who know their response well

dosing_schedules.name: Daily Microdosing
dosing_schedules.schedule: Every day for 30 days, then break
dosing_schedules.frequency: 7 days per week for limited duration
dosing_schedules.rationale: Some use for short intensive period, though tolerance is a concern
dosing_schedules.caution: Risk of tolerance, receptor downregulation; take extended breaks

protocol_selection.recommended_default: Fadiman Protocol (every 3 days) for first-time microdosers

dose_determination.calibration_approach: Start low, increase gradually until finding sweet spot (just below perceptual threshold)

volumetric_dosing.importance: CRITICAL - LSD doses are tiny, accurate measurement essential
volumetric_dosing.method: Dissolve known amount of LSD (e.g., 100 mcg tab) in measured volume of distilled water or alcohol (e.g., 10 mL)
volumetric_dosing.calculation: If 100 mcg in 10 mL, then 1 mL = 10 mcg; use oral syringe for accurate measurement
volumetric_dosing.storage: Amber glass bottle, refrigerated, protected from light
volumetric_dosing.stability: Stable for weeks to months if stored properly

signs_dose_too_high: Mild visual changes (breathing walls, color enhancement)
dose_determination.signs_dose_too_low: No noticeable effects even after several weeks
dose_determination.goal: Subtle enhancement, not impairment - 'feeling more like yourself at your best'

branch_outcomes.description: Every other day or other selected schedule

steps.title: Dose Calibration & First Microdose
steps.description: Initial microdosing session to calibrate dose, ensure it is truly sub-perceptual, and educate on tracking and expectations. Ideally supervised or with check-in.

calibration_protocol.setting: Comfortable, safe environment; ideally at home on a free day
calibration_protocol.timing: Morning (7-9 AM) to assess effects throughout day and avoid sleep interference
preparation: Clear schedule (no important commitments first calibration day)
Notebook or app ready for tracking

first_dose.recommended: Start with 10 mcg (or 5 mcg if very cautious)
first_dose.administration: Oral - sublingual for faster onset, or swallow
first_dose.volumetric_dosing: Use prepared volumetric solution with oral syringe
first_dose.documentation: Record exact dose, time, stomach contents

monitoring_timeline.T+30_min: Beginning to notice anything? (Ideally no at proper microdose)
monitoring_timeline.T+60_min: Any perceptual changes, mood shifts, energy changes?
monitoring_timeline.T+90_min: Peak effects (if any) usually around this time
monitoring_timeline.T+180_min: Assess overall effect - too much, too little, or just right?
monitoring_timeline.end_of_day: Reflect on entire day - productivity, mood, social interactions, creativity

dose_adjustment.if_subtle_positive_effects: Stay at this dose - you found it!
dose_adjustment.calibration_period: First 2-3 doses are for finding optimal dose

safety_instructions: Do not drive or operate machinery if feeling ANY alteration
Have a sober, trusted person you can call if needed
Avoid combining with alcohol or other drugs during calibration
If uncomfortable effects, remind yourself it's temporary (will pass in 6-8 hours)

steps.title: Week 1 Check-In & Protocol Refinement
steps.description: First check-in after 3-4 microdoses to review experiences, refine dose if needed, address concerns, and ensure proper tracking.

experience_review: How have the microdose days felt?
Any perceptual effects? (If yes, dose likely too high)
How about the 'off' days - any difference?
tracking_review: Any noticeable differences between dose days and off days?
dose_optimization: Current dose too high, too low, or appropriate?
Aim for subtle, barely noticeable effects - 'like a good day'
protocol_adherence: Any temptation to dose more frequently?
expectation_management: Remind: effects are subtle, not dramatic
Changes may be more noticeable in retrospect after a few weeks
Placebo effect is real and that's okay - it's part of the benefit
Not a magic bullet - works best with healthy lifestyle, therapy, etc.

dose_adjustments.increase_dose: If no effects after 3-4 doses and no perceptual changes
dose_adjustments.decrease_dose: If any perceptual effects or feeling 'too stimulated'
dose_adjustments.maintain_dose: If subtle positive effects without impairment

steps.title: Week 4 Evaluation - Early Outcomes
steps.description: Month 1 evaluation to assess early benefits, side effects, adherence, and whether to continue protocol. Decision point for continuation.

subjective_assessment: What's better? What's the same or worse?
tracking_data_review: Dose days vs. off days patterns
adherence: How well did you stick to the schedule?
Any missed doses or extra doses?

outcome_categories.clear_benefit: Measurable improvement in mood, cognition, or well-being; minimal side effects
outcome_categories.subtle_benefit: Small improvements or subjective sense of benefit; hard to quantify
outcome_categories.unclear: No clear pattern yet; may need more time or dose adjustment

steps.title: Continue, Adjust, or Discontinue Decision
steps.description: Clinical decision based on Week 4 evaluation: continue current protocol, adjust dose/schedule, or discontinue microdosing.

decision_matrix.decision: Continue current protocol for another 8 weeks (total 12 weeks), then reassess
Consider dose adjustment (increase if no perceptual effects yet) OR continue current protocol to give more time
decision_matrix.rationale: May need more time or optimization

decision_matrix.decision: Options: (1) Try dose increase for 2-4 more weeks, (2) Try different schedule, (3) Discontinue
decision_matrix.rationale: Reassess whether worth continuing if no benefit

dose_schedule_adjustments.if_tolerance_developing: Switch from daily or frequent dosing to Fadiman protocol; take tolerance break (1-2 weeks off)
dose_schedule_adjustments.if_effects_too_subtle: Increase dose by 5 mcg; or increase frequency (e.g., Fadiman to every other day)
dose_schedule_adjustments.if_effects_too_strong: Decrease dose by 5 mcg; or decrease frequency
dose_schedule_adjustments.if_sleep_issues: Dose earlier in day, skip afternoon doses, or take 1-2 week break

tolerance_break_consideration.rationale: Prevent tolerance, reset receptor sensitivity, assess whether benefits persist
tolerance_break_consideration.restarting: Can resume at same dose/schedule after break

branch_outcomes.description: Continue current microdosing schedule for full 12-week trial
Modify dose or schedule, continue for 8 more weeks

steps.title: Week 8 Mid-Point Check-In
steps.description: Brief check-in at 8 weeks to ensure continued safety, benefit, and adherence. Address any emerging issues.
check_in_focus: Any new side effects or concerns?
Any life changes or stressors affecting response?
safety_check: Any signs of psychological dependence? (Anxiety about missing doses, preoccupation with microdosing)

steps.title: Week 12 Final Evaluation & Long-Term Planning
steps.description: Comprehensive end-of-protocol evaluation at 12 weeks. Assess overall outcomes, decide on long-term approach (continue, tolerance break, discontinue), and create maintenance plan.

comprehensive_outcomes: Compare all metrics to baseline (PHQ-9, GAD-7, well-being, creativity, cognition, sleep)
Review 12 weeks of tracking data for patterns
subjective_global_assessment: What would you attribute to microdosing vs. other factors?
Did it meet your initial goals?
Would you recommend it to others in your situation?
safety_review: Psychological stability (no psychotic symptoms, mood destabilization)?

options: Continue indefinitely with periodic tolerance breaks (1 week off every 4-8 weeks)
Take extended tolerance break (4-8 weeks) then reassess if you want to resume
Taper to less frequent schedule (e.g., weekly instead of twice weekly)
Discontinue and see if benefits persist (they often do)
if_successful.recommended_approach: Tolerance break of 4 weeks, then reassess. Many benefits may persist without continued dosing.
if_successful.monitoring: Monthly check-ins for 3 months, then as needed

options: Explore adjunctive approaches (therapy, meditation, lifestyle changes)
Consider alternatives (psilocybin microdosing, therapeutic full doses, etc.)
Consider whether dosing was accurate (underdosing common issue)
Explore other evidence-based treatments for your goals
Consider therapeutic-dose psychedelic sessions if appropriate

long_term_safety: Annual cardiovascular check-up (concern for valvular heart disease with chronic serotonergic agonism is theoretical but monitor)
Avoid long-term daily use (risk of tolerance, receptor changes)
Don't increase dose over time chasing effects (tolerance sign)
Quality control of source material (purity, accurate dosing)
red_flags_to_discontinue: Developing tolerance (needing higher doses for same effect)
Psychotic symptoms (paranoia, delusions, hallucinations outside of dosing)

if_continuing_long_term.frequency: Monthly check-ins first 3 months after initial protocol, then quarterly

tolerance_breaks.recommendation: 1 week off every 4-8 weeks of continuous microdosing, or 4-8 weeks off after 12 weeks continuous
tolerance_breaks.purpose: Prevent tolerance, receptor downregulation, and allow assessment of benefits without substance
tolerance_breaks.during_break: Note if symptoms return or benefits persist (often persist)

annual_review.comprehensive_assessment: Yearly evaluation of continued benefit, safety, and need for continuation
annual_review.cardiovascular_screen: BP, HR, ECG (concern for cardiac valve issues with chronic 5-HT2B agonism is theoretical but prudent)

potential_adverse_effects.management: Reduce dose, dose earlier in day, or skip doses
Dose earlier in day (morning only), reduce dose, or take break
Reduce dose to truly sub-perceptual level
Discontinue, consider whether underlying mood disorder
Reduce dose or discontinue; may not be right approach for this individual
Tolerance break, address underlying issues, discontinue
Discontinue immediately, supportive care, usually resolves

signs_of_problematic_use: Anxiety or distress on off days
Neglecting other self-care (exercise, therapy, sleep) in favor of microdosing

considerations: Very common combination
SSRIs/SNRIs may blunt LSD effects due to receptor downregulation
No serotonin syndrome risk (LSD is agonist, not releaser)
May need higher LSD microdose or may not respond as well
Safe to combine from pharmacological standpoint
Do not discontinue SSRIs to microdose without medical supervision
Anecdotal reports of benefit for focus and executive function
Limited research evidence
May respond differently than neurotypical individuals
Consider interaction with ADHD stimulant medications
Track ADHD symptoms specifically
LSD can bring up suppressed emotions or memories
May be therapeutic if processing with therapist
Can be destabilizing if not in therapy or unprepared
Trauma-informed approach essential
Close monitoring and integration support
Common user group seeking creativity enhancement
Evidence is mixed - some studies show benefit, others placebo
May enhance divergent thinking (idea generation)
May or may not enhance convergent thinking (problem-solving)
Track creative output objectively (projects completed, quality ratings)

placebo_considerations.importance: Recent research suggests significant placebo effect in microdosing
studies: Szigeti et al. (2021): Self-blinding citizen science trial found placebo accounted for much of benefit
However, expectancy effects are part of therapeutic benefit - not a reason to dismiss
implications: Set realistic expectations - benefits may be subtle or partially placebo
Placebo response is still a real benefit if improving quality of life
Combine with other evidence-based practices (therapy, lifestyle changes)
Don't rely solely on microdosing as treatment for serious conditions
Self-experimentation and tracking help determine individual response

self_blinding_option.description: Some individuals use self-blinding protocol (mix microdoses with placebo in identical capsules, randomize)
self_blinding_option.purpose: Control for placebo effect and discern true drug effects
self_blinding_option.practicality: Requires extra effort but increases scientific rigor of self-experiment

legal_status.most_countries: LSD is Schedule I (USA) or equivalent - illegal to possess, distribute, or use
legal_status.exceptions: Some jurisdictions decriminalizing or researching psychedelics
legal_status.risk: Legal consequences including arrest, prosecution, criminal record
legal_status.medical_recommendation: This protocol is for informational, educational, or research purposes in legal contexts only

sourcing_concerns.purity: Illicit LSD purity and dosing highly variable
sourcing_concerns.safety: Risk of adulterants, incorrect dosing, contamination
sourcing_concerns.recommendation: If legal/research setting, obtain from legitimate research chemical supplier or pharmacy; if not, test substances and use harm reduction

workplace_considerations.drug_testing: LSD generally not tested for in standard workplace drug screens, but specialized tests exist
workplace_considerations.impairment: True microdose should not cause impairment, but individual responses vary
workplace_considerations.disclosure: Consider risks/benefits of disclosing microdosing to employer

clinical_pearls: Less is more - truly sub-perceptual dosing is the goal, not feeling 'high'
Patience required - effects are subtle and may take weeks to notice
Tracking is essential - without it, hard to discern patterns or benefits
Placebo effect is real and significant - that's okay, it's still benefit
Not a magic bullet - works best combined with therapy, lifestyle optimization, social connection
Quality and accurate dosing matter - volumetric dosing is essential
Tolerance breaks prevent receptor downregulation and allow reassessment
Individual responses vary wildly - some people benefit greatly, others not at all
Safety screening is important - psychedelics, even at low doses, are not for everyone
Integration and reflection enhance benefits - journaling, therapy, mindfulness
Legal risks are real - proceed with caution and awareness of jurisdiction
Research is still emerging - we don't have all the answers yet
